credit_line: Selection from the Peterson Collection, Gift of William Bingham II
title: Sixteen scenes of life of the famous Kwo Tsu -I
description: subject is Kuo Tzu-i, who was a famous general from the T'ang Dynasty (618-906).
inscriptions: l.c. stamped in red: [artist's seal]; along lower edge in ink: Fan 6 1/2 x 19" Depicts in 16 scenes life of the famous Kwo Tsu -I the generalissimo during the reighs of T'ang emperors - the colors on paper by Hsiao Yuin who lived in reigns of/ - last two Ming emperors; l.r. in pencil: Substitute for 83 catalogue; l.r. in blue pencil: 83A; l.r. on blue sticker: WILLIAMS PC.19
